bug.short_desc: leverage support for modular targets in Tycho 0.18

long_desc.thetext:
With Tycho 0.18 it's possible to specify multiple targets. When using the slicer mode this would work well to combine a base target with a connector specific target.
We should also consider exporting the development target as a categorized repository to enable developers to select the relevant dependencies for their environment easily:
pre.. <category-def name="all" label="All Orbit Bundles"/> <iu> <category name="all"/> <query><expression type="match">providedCapabilities.exists(p | p.namespace == 'osgi.bundle')</expression></query> </iu>
<category-def name="apache" label="Orbit Bundles By Name: org.apache.*"/> <iu> <category name="apache"/> <query><expression type="match">id ~= /org.apache.*/</expression></query> </iu>
As a first step I have updated the build to consume Tycho 0.18.1: https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/16814/.

One interesting and related approach is https://github.com/mbarbero/fr.obeo.releng.targetplatform/ , which uses a DSL to define target platform definitions. The possibility of managing multiple target platform definitions is discussed at https://github.com/mbarbero/fr.obeo.releng.targetplatform/issues/13 .
